page.title: 12USE OF GRASSLAND IN ALKHAM.
page.content: The land on the slopes of the valley being too steep for modern agricultural machinery is used for rough grazing.Throughout the year sheep graze in these large fields which occupy approximately 40% of the total land area.During winter and in particular at lambing time in early spring the sheep are brought to pasture fields nearer the farm buildings so that a closer eye can be kept on them.These fields on the lower slopes also provide hay and silage for the winter months and pasture for small herds of bullocks during the summer. The sheep are breed for both wool and meat.Contract shearers visit most farms in the area during May.Lambs are sold at Ashford and Canterbury livestock markets.
